questions.question: Which platform is best for beginners to deploy static sites?
questions.explanation: Netlify is beginner-friendly with easy drag-and-drop deployment and free hosting for static sites.

questions.question: What does SSL provide?
questions.explanation: SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) provides encrypted HTTPS connections, securing data transmission.

questions.question: What is lazy loading?
questions.explanation: Lazy loading defers loading of images until they're needed (when user scrolls near them), improving performance.

questions.question: What should you remove before deploying?
questions.explanation: console.log statements should be removed in production as they can expose debugging information and slow down execution.

questions.question: What is a portfolio?
questions.explanation: A portfolio is a collection of your work that showcases your skills and projects to potential employers or clients.

questions.question: What does CDN stand for?
questions.explanation: CDN stands for Content Delivery Network, a network of servers that deliver content quickly to users worldwide.

questions.question: What are three things to check before deploying a website?
questions.explanation: Before deploying, check: browser compatibility, mobile responsiveness, all links work, images optimized, console.logs removed, forms work, performance is good, and HTML/CSS is valid.

questions.question: Why is performance optimization important?
questions.explanation: Performance optimization improves user experience, reduces bounce rates, improves SEO rankings, saves bandwidth for mobile users, and can increase conversion rates.
